sentences: Hobuse, lehma, sea, hundi, mao, vaala, haugi lõuad.
Kass tuleb, hiir lõugade vahel, lõugus.
Hiir pääses kassi lõugade vahelt, lõugust.
context: Lõuad is the plural form of 'lõug' in Estonian. It primarily refers to the jaws of animals and humans - specifically the movable parts that form the boundaries of the mouth opening in vertebrates, supported by jawbones. In human context, it can also colloquially refer to someone who talks too much or has a big mouth.
